criteria: Understanding of Structure and Properties of Matter
descriptions: No observations are made, and no data is collected.
Minimal observations are made with little to no relevant data collected.
Some relevant observations are made, and some data is collected, but there are gaps or inaccuracies.
Relevant observations are made, and data is collected, but there could be more detail or accuracy.
Detailed and relevant observations are made, and comprehensive data is collected accurately.
Exceptional observations are made with insightful data collection, demonstrating a deep understanding of the object's properties and changes.
No attempt is made to construct an evidence-based account.
An attempt is made to construct an account, but it lacks evidence and clarity.
An account is constructed with some evidence, but the reasoning is unclear or incomplete.
A clear account is constructed with supporting evidence, but connections between evidence and conclusions could be stronger.
A well-reasoned and evidence-based account is constructed, clearly explaining how the object was disassembled and reassembled.
A sophisticated and compelling evidence-based account is constructed, demonstrating a deep understanding of the underlying principles and concepts.
Demonstrates no understanding of the structure and properties of matter.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of the structure and properties of matter.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of the structure and properties of matter, but struggles to apply it.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of the structure and properties of matter and applies it effectively.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the structure and properties of matter and applies it creatively.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the structure and properties of matter and applies it insightfully.
The account is unclear and difficult to understand.
The account is somewhat understandable but lacks clarity and organization.
The account is generally clear but could benefit from improved organization and vocabulary.
The account is clear, well-organized, and uses appropriate vocabulary.
The account is articulate, coherent, and uses precise scientific language.
The account is exceptionally well-written, engaging, and demonstrates a mastery of scientific communication.
